Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Family”
Reviews.Author: zicron
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 3 bedroom suite for family of 5 adults 1 child. Two of the bedrooms can accomodate perhaps 2 adults 1 child max, remaining bedroom 1 adult max. Limited luggage space, but it wasn't really an issue, as we left our luggages in the living room. Only one toilet. Small issue with toilet having no main door, shower area has frosted glass, so you can probably see a person's silhouette whilst he is taking a bath. But it's not really a problem as the there's a door to the latrine which outswings to cover the main toilet which can be used to indicate that somebody's in the bath and it blocks the line of sight from the living room to the bathroom. Overall service is very receptive, sensitive to needs, and we even got a free Godiva chocolate gift as an apology for waking us up wrongly in the morning because another guest gave them the wrong room number. Breakfast area a little lacking on the size of the seating space, but then again for the price we are paying, no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for Family”
Reviews.Author: peachsorbet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3-bedroom apartment for 5 nights this serviced apartment. There were 6 of us actually, my parents, my brother, and my family (husband and little kid)... and yes, we managed to squeeze into the apartment. Our luggages fit fine, as we unpacked everything into the drawers and hung up our stuff, so we didn't have to keep accessing the luggages. We could just put the luggage in a corner. Bed-wise, it was a squeeze for the 3 of us into one queen-bed. But it wasn't too bad either. Then again, we're asian and generally smaller built. Beds were comfy and we slept well. The blackout blinds in the bedroom worked wonders. Bathroom... there was only one bathroom without a door (there are doors that close on the shower and the water-closet separately). The shower door was translucent, so to provide some privacy, we used the water-closet door to block the view from the living room to the shower. Location... very good. Yes, it's abit of a walk to the MTRs, but both MTRs were on the more accessible lines so didn't require much changing of trains once we were there. It was fine for us to walk... except the little one with the lazy bones who wanted to be carried. Crockery... If it wasn't enough, you could ask for more. Breakfast... simple but enough. Buns, pastries, fruits, toast... I think there was usually quite a queue for the coffee machine. Sometimes we bought back food from nearby like the chee cheong fun, and dimsum for breakfast. Very modern hotel and very comfortable. My daughter liked it alot and kept asking to go back to the hotel after being dragged around the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel For Families”
Reviews.Author: AussieinBeijing
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five who have just returned from a two night stay in this hotel. Yes the space is quite small but practical. We did struggle to find room for our luggage (to be fair we had a lot as we were returning from a family holiday in Australia). We enjoyed staying at this hotel and the location was no problem for us. I actually enjoyed the view from the windows and the fact that it is in a local area. Taxi's are not expensive so we used them to get to and from the main train stations. Breakfast was basic but fine. Beds were comfortable. We didn't experience happy hour as were never in the hotel during this time. The only minor complaint that I would have is that there was no tea towel, washing up liquid or enough crockery for the five of us. All in all though we would definitely stay there again as it was a nice hotel and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Different Experience of Stay”
Reviews.Author: udcbtm
Reviews.Content: Ovolo 256 Tung Chau Street is located at Kowloon area where you can feel the local of HK, the people, the surrounding, and the food. Around 10 to 15 minutes walk from the nearest MTR Nam Cheong of Sham Shui Po (depend with who you are walking with). I prefer to choose MTR Sham Shui Po if travel to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui line-however, its crowded until afternoon-many food and shop but a bit quite at night. If you want to go to Disneyland, Lantau Island (Ngong Ping 360), take Tung CHung LIne from MTR Nam Cheong. TO HKIA, stop at Tsing Yi Station and transfer with HKIA Express-very convenient. You can also take bus at Lai Chi Kok road which is only 3 blocks from the hotel-but it takes more time to wait and sometimes bus will take a longer route to the destination-however, MTR is still the best choice. The hotel is small but very well decorated and have unique concept to traveler. The lobby and lounge is amazing and cool to sit (when the outdoor weather is too hot to handle), room is white and layout is cleverly designed even the each bedroom is small to keep our luggage. Great concept for service area, 3 people can do 3 activities at the same time in the morning (bingo!!!). Free laundry, free snack and happy hours between 6-8pm, indoor gym, free coffe corner, simple breakfast with pastry and cereal, free Wifi, apple tv, free minibar, spacious pantry for the whole family tospend the night to chat and dine. Off course there are some minus: housekeeping not too well-stained and dust at corner of shower room and living room floor, coffee maker is out of service (i can taste coffee only at my first night), I locked my stuff in the deposit box because the battery is degenerated and they forget to replace. Luckily the staff is quick in responding. I will recommend to stay here for family traveling together..it feels like to stay at home. GOOD JOB OVOLO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but very comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: gweegin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a really local neighbourhood (i.e. away from major shopping malls and tourist sights), but only 2 MTR stops away from Tsim Sha Tsui East so it is still convenient. I like that the neighbourhood allows me to see the real Hong Kong with so much local flavour. The rooms, though small, make good use of the limited space and you can find everything you would need in the small space. TV, DVD player, kitchenette, bathroom, wardrobe etc. are provided in the room. You also get free use of the washing machines and dryers, which is a nice touch. Best of all, the happy hour (from 6 - 8pm daily) gives you free flow drinks, including alcohol, and snacks. Front desk staff were also always helpful. Security is stringent, as you have to scan your room card to enter the elevator lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay but away from bustling city center”
Reviews.Author: StephSeow
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few service apartments that had 3 bedroom apartment options and given that we were a travelling party of 12 - it was a better option instead of 6 hotel rooms. We each spent around SGD250 each for 4 nights (2x 3 bedroom apts and 1x 2 bedroom apt) - this was one of the more affordable rates for a stay in Hong Kong. The rooms were nicely furnished, very comfortable and most importantly, it was clean. It felt almost like home! Like what many of the other reviewers mentioned, the glass panels at the shower area were frosted and hence you could make out the shape of the individual while bathing - this was easily resolved by using the door of the toilet cubicle to create and expand the toilet area. It also made it easier to dress up given the size of the shower area. Rooms were cosy and beds were really comfortable for a good night's sleep.the hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful - we received great service while there. Best thing about the place? the 6-8pm happy hour - we were caught in a typhoon one night while in HKG and made it in time for the happy hour. they provided free flow of soft drinks, Tsingtao beer, coffee/tea and even 4 types of hard liqour! the pantry area also had comfortable sofas for you to lounge and enjoy some conversations with friends/family. Breakfast was also provided as part of the costs - very simple fare (and the same everyday we were there) - some chicken/mushroom pies, nespresso coffee, crossiant, muffins etc.. the hotel is about a 10mins walk to Nam Cheong Station and 6 mins walk to Sham Shui Po station - not that near either ways but you really do get to experience and feel like a local.

Reviews.Title: “weird room configuration.”
Reviews.Author: alex_saopaulo_11
Reviews.Content: despite by the very scary location, many abbandoned looking buildings on the surroundings, this is a hotel that have it all to be a great hotel, but there's some major mistakes when they builded it. for some reason the room have some huge tv rack in the midle of the room but no table or desk, they devided the room in 2 cubicles so tiny that you can not move around, no place for lugage, the bathroom floor is another major mistake, rough granite, it already look old and dirty, not the right floor for a bathroom. my sugestions to this hotel: take out the wall between the rooms and put a queen bed on it, Move the TV from the living room to the bedroom, There will be space for a table or a desk, the white sofa is too big and white is not the best color for a hotel, in my room it already looked dirty. Do something about the bathroom floor and put a door in the bathroom please. you don't need apple TV, DVD, all those trinkets.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: kida_khalid
Reviews.Content: Me & my family stayed at Ovolo 256 in mid March 2012 (sorry for the delayed review). We were having trouble looking for places to stay at in HK since theres usually a maximum occupancy limit to the room, and we were in such a big group! 8 adults and 6 kids. So the Ovolo was a good choice, we took 2 units of their 3-bedroom apartments, and the thing i loved most was the spacious living area where we can hang out and watch tv etc. Yes, the room is preeettttty tight, but for that price, the only other option is probably one of those eery dodgy hotels in chungking mansions! cant find proper hotels for the same price ovolo offers. Pros: 1. complimentary breakfast. we were very happy with the selection of bread, pastries, cereal and drinks. 2. complimentary snacks in the room! awesome 3. modern, clean & comfortable 4. free wifi!! Cons: 1. 15mins walk to the the MTR sham shui po station (ok fine i was lazy to walk, it was rainy season :P). The area can be quite "scary" at night, esp if you're travelling with six kids! it just has that old area feel to it, like those u see in jackiechan movies. Its more of a local's area than a tourist's area. 2. LIft sensors were quite unresponsive, dont let your kids play around it by themselves! We were loading the lift with our bags when the kids ran in, after a few seconds the door closed and the kids were closed in. Luckily the lift just went down and back up again! Close call! Overall it was a good stay.but i think next time i would stay nearer to town :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Worth It!!!”
Reviews.Author: IndraZareen
Reviews.Content: For those who have not been to hk, do take note that it is a modern and expensive place similar to where I live in, Singapore. so don't expect yr room to be the size of a hotel room in Phuket or Bali. this hotel is strongly recommended if you have a family or in a group. the size of the room is good and most importantly the beds are comfortable and it is clean, well maintained. location of the hotel is in the heartland, so you need to adapt to the local environment. it is located in between 2 mrt stations, both about 10mins walk and it is safe passing thru street markets. Overall it's value for money as it includes free wifi, continental breakfast, self laundry, rental of DVDs in room, cable tv. the only complaint is theres no pool but then again who needs the pool when most of the day you will be exploring the city with your octopus card.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever! We left and got a refund.”
Reviews.Author: EmPickering
Reviews.Content: Ok. Where do I start!! The hotel is located in an extremely dodgy area. The actual hotel is clean but the rooms are tiny. Our "spacious 2 bedroom apartment" consisted of two bedrooms that were literally the size of the double beds inside them. The "full kitchen facilities" consisted of a microwave and 2 plates and sets of cutlery (no dish washing liquid, tea towel etc). The Bathroom requires you to light the hot water sustem while Inside the shower (wtf) .Our family (2 adults and 2 small kids) was extremely disappointed and left after night one of our four day booking. The website and photos are extremely misleading and I will not be recommending this place to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 3-bedroom apartment”
Reviews.Author: GT18
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in hong kong, therefore, i can't say if the hotel was at par with hong kong standards. However, i loved the place. They were able to maximize the space, making it comfortable for a big group like ours. I was there with my mom, mom-in-law, husband, and our two kids (6 & 1). My sister and her husband even joined us the following night. We were able to sleep comfortably. They serve drinks at the lounge 24 hours a day! You can have coffee, soda, tea, juice, and even beer. But i think beer was only free during a specific time of the day, sorry, not sure coz i currently don't drink. They also offer breakfast at the lounge. There were limited choices though but it was still good enough. Everything in the room including some chips and chocolates were complimentary. It was also cheap compared to other hotels i've checked online. It's just that it is quite far from the mtr. Google map says it is an 8 minute walk but it wasn't, not for us with huge luggages, two senior citizens and two kids! It was also a bit hard to find because it did not seem popular. the people we asked help from did not know where it was. They also didnt have a restaurant. you have to find food outside. But the staffs were very helpful. I would consider staying there again when i go back to hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKCLPJJB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights. One thing that we must commend is the hotel’s clever use of the minimal space that they have. The hotel provides free drinks in the lobby all day, and alcoholic drinks during happy hour (i.e. 6-8pm). In addition, it is actually the only hotel that we have been to that that also provides guests with complimentary drinks (including beer and orange juice) together with a wide selection of snacks in rooms (albeit on one occasion only for the entire duration of one's stay). The hotel is ‘reasonably located’ as it is within walking distance of two MTR stations. There are lot of places to eat in the Sham Shui Po area and it is also located fairly close to Mongkok. We say ‘reasonably located’ because our verdict is that the hotel can be seemed to be a bit 'out of the way' and 'isolated' for solo female guests trekking home at night, as they would need to negotiate a few dark alleys/quiet streets. Although the rooms are clean, we did however noticed that our bed sheet had not been changed throughout our stay, unless they happen to have another bed sheet that has a marking in exactly the same place. Although we would like to all do our bit for the environment but I guess, it would perhaps be justified to change the sheet at least once in 7 days. The customer service is good but could be more consistent. Overall, we were fairly happy with this hotel and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: rakas
Reviews.Content: As my title implies, this is a great value apartment style hotel in a reasonable location, with and 2 and 3 bedroom aprtments for less than1500HKD. Rooms are OK, bedrooms 2 and 3 a little tight! Proper size fridge and big screen TV. There are 3 apartments per floor and if you're lucky 2 of these have great harbour views. Perfect for families needing extra space and/or those who want to escape your average claustrophobic HK hotel rooms!! Gym is quite small. Breakfast more continental style but OK. Best thing is that they have free drinks and snacks each night from 6pm with snacks, beer, 3 or 4 spirits, coffee, soft drinks etc. Staff at Ovolo company itself as well as the Hotel are outstanding. Nam Cheong and Sham Sui Po MTR stations are close by, Nam Cheong about 5 min walk as is the Dragon Centre Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Ovolo 256”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Eion
Reviews.Content: 6 years back, me and my hubby was staying in this apartment, after 6 years this apartment is so nicely renovated. Love it so much, we stay on the 23rd floor, it's clean and big, although it's abit far from the MTR, but the amount of money we pay is totally worth it. The only thing that is not so good, it's their breakfast (Not much choice) but anyway there is lots of good food in Hong Kong. We will stay in this hotel on our next visit to Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good stay”
Reviews.Author: Robano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ovolo with our two year old daughter in may 2012. The rooms were small, which meant there was only room for a bed and not much else. Despite this, we enjoyed our stay. The service was friendly. The breakfasts were simple but sufficient. The neighbourhood surrounding the Ovolo is in a state of transition and on first view looks a little grungy, however over the 6 days we were there, we saw through the dirt and really enjoyed the charm of West Kowloon. There's a nice park across the road which our daughter loved. There's also plenty of shops for basics. The only gripe about our room was that the kitchen lacked basic things like plates, bowls, cutlery etc. Also the air conditioning in the main breakfast room was broken for the first 4 days, so breakfasts quickly became sweat-fests. The MTR (subway) is very close, however if you have a pram you'll need to conquer Hong Kong's aversion to lifts which is particularly tedious in the early summer heat. We booked through their site, rather than going through a third-party site like Wotif. For the price, I think this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You OVOLO Team”
Reviews.Author: XaLex_C
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed with this property before in their first month of opening. I was convinced that this property was the hidden gem in Hong Kong. I’ve done extensive research on accommodation for my second visit to HK and yet still find this Ovolo property best for our traveling needs. We appreciate the excellent hospitality given by the wonderful team, this was one of the reasons we returned. The location is excellent and we managed to get around fairly easily. We did however, have a few concerns with our stay this time around. Firstly, upon check-in we had found hair in the toilet drainage cover, a disposable contact lens set and the shower faucet was loose when we turned it on, water sprays out from the faucet. Making a call to the reception regarding this, the response was “I’m sorry we are full today” and that there was no possibility to change rooms. (This was 3pm in the afternoon) And lastly, there was a microwave, fridge, 3 sets of cutlery, can opener, kitchen scissors and bottle opener but there were no plates or bowls. I found it strange because these items were all provided during my initial stay. We had to collect the plates from reception. The simple breakfast in the morning has improved! We are very happy about that. You can borrow an iPad/Wii/Xbox from the reception, this was a very unique touch to a hotel I’ve ever stayed in. The Nintendo Wii kept my and my partner occupied in the evenings. We would like to return to your hotel in our future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and comfortable rooms and the price is right..”
Reviews.Author: iznar4
Reviews.Content: I needed a three bedroom unit and found them to be the most affordable for my holiday. Location was in between two different MTR lines ie Stations Sham Shui Po and Nam Cheong. Near to Apliu flea market where you can get cheap bargains. Halal food is easily available within Dragon Centre as well as across the street. Free wifi internet in the rooms. Helpful and friendly service staffs from reception to guards and chambermaids. Recommended for those that needs 3 bedroom units.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling customer service over ruined laundry - DO NO STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: NiHa13
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about this place - especially its out of the way location, the lack of proper curtains making it hard for us all to sleep because of the light - but the when our laundry came back with 4 badly shrunk, now unwearable items and they blamed it on us, I would advise everyone I know to stay elsewhere. Problems occur, but it's how they're handled that are the true test of a place. Being a costly place, and given the high price of their laundry and dry cleaning, I thought it would be properly done. When I reported the shrinkage to the manager, I was told to 'ignore that because it's bag wash and charged by the kilo'. Nowhere does it say that on the form. However in the (very) fine print it absolves the hotel of everything. They basically pretend their laundry service is one thing when it's an entirely different thing. If I'd wanted a bag wash I would have gone down the road forwhalf the price and never would have included my favourite pants (that I machine wash all the time at home by the way). Also, we are in a 3 bedroom place and there are only 2 glasses and cups, cutlery for 3 and no plates at all or cooking implements except for a kettle, microwave and toaster. We kept running out of toilet paper but housekeeping never brought us more when we asked. Also, the beds are hard and pillows soft. There is no bathroom door and no washIng machine or facility to hang hand washing on. Also the rooms are smaller than they look online. When we booked, the address was not supplied to us Sony the agent Rick. We had to call him and he texted us in Chinese so I had to fine it myself at HK airport. Luckily they have free wifi there.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price with Unbelievable Facilites !!”
Reviews.Author: Dalimartha
Reviews.Content: The reason for me when we choose this place because its well designed and location. Me & my cousin had stayed for 5 days, here we go for pros & cons : PROS : 1. Location : Very good, really close to Mongkok & Ferry Harbour. 2. Facilities : Unbelieveable !! High speed internet, toaster, 3 ACs in 45m2 apartment, iron table, cocktail hour from 6PM - 8PM, local phone is free, Big LCD TV, Ipod dock, iTV, DVD player, microwave, hot shower, plates, forks & spoon, knives. 3. Room design : the designer knows how to maximize small space. 4. Service : really helpful staffs for sure. CONS : 1. They dont provide meal. So we ordered Mcd or KFC. Its a small apartment but really eficent, until this moment this is the best place I ever stayed in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very clever use of space!”
Reviews.Author: GoddessEneri
Reviews.Content: Love the feel of the hotel. Although it's not very spacious (as most of the hotels in Hong Kong), the clever use of space makes it very comfortable for my friends and I. The bedrooms are a bit cramped though, but no complains there. From the hotel's map, it looked like it's nearer to Nam Cheong MTR station. However, I find it more convenient to walk from Sham Shui Po MTR station, as it's just a straight road. Plus, there are rows and rows of shops and eateries along the road from SSP MTR. But, the SSP line seems more crowded than the NC line. Hotel's breakfast was simple; croissants, cinnamon rolls and some breads. But it was good! The best hotel's bread I've ever had :) Only complain is that they only have day curtain in the living area. I could see what my neighbour was watching on the TV at night! Would be good if they could install some blinds or night curtain for privacy. Also, the bathroom 'wall' is actually frosted glass. I could see my friend's silhouette when she was bathing while I was sitting on the sofa watching TV. Might not be too convenient if we were travelling in a mixed group. Had to tell our male friend not to go to the toilet (next to the shower area) when we were bahthing :) Overall, it's clean, convenient and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay for big groups”
Reviews.Author: tkjy
Reviews.Content: It's not easy to find cheap hotels in HK and we were glad that we managed to find this on the Internet. We were a group of five adults and took the 3-bedroom apartment for 2 nights. Was given a high floor but the view wasn't that fantastic - was only able to see the housing estates in the neighbourhood which didn't look that great. Rooms were small but sufficient. Two of the bedrooms had a double bed each, while the other had a single bed. The rooms were small, with a bed and a wardrobe but it was well-equipped. And considering that hotels in HK were generally small, we were contented with our rooms. There's also the living room area which was an additional plus as we could pack our luggages in the area. There was also a kitchen area with a toaster and fridge, and a high table which provided us with a space for dining. One down side is the toilet. The toilet has an open concept; there is no door at the toilet, which may be a little inconvenient. Breakfast was complimentary on the lobby area (first floor). There were pies, muffins, bread, yoghurt, coffee/tea, etc. Bottled drinks were also available in the fridge, but were only for consumption in the lobby area. Hotel staffs were generally helpful and considerate. Security guard at the entrance was also very friendly. Overall, the service was great. Location wise, it is about a 10 minute walk from either train station (Nam Cheong or Sham Shui Po). Not exactly very near, but not that far either. It may be a little of a hassle and tiring if you're carrying alot of bags after a whole day of shopping. Taxi may be a better choice for big groups, but do bring along the hotel's namecard as not all taxi drivers are familiar with Ovolo. I would choose to stay at Ovolo again if I am travelling in a big group.

Reviews.Title: “Best Things come in Small Packages - Less is More Part 31”
Reviews.Author: ECKLKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: Finding affordable AND quality accommodations in HK is super difficult so stumbling upon Ovolo over the internet was a bit of a godsend. As we were traveling in a party of 7 (with young children & elderly parents), we needed the convenience & practicality of a small apartment set up. The West Kowloon branch (OWK) is the only one with 3BR options. Firstly, this is located in the working class neighborhood of Sham Shui Po (the MTR is a 10-min walk away). It is NOT the slick, modern and cosmopolitan face of HK; so please be aware. But for history & culture buffs, this neighborhood represents the HK of old which is fast disappearing (we saw numerous notices plastered on old tenement buildings slated for urban renewal). It can also be a goldmine for photography enthusiasts. There is a lively street market and in the evenings, it transforms into a 2nd hand/antique bazaar. Secondly, OWK is a new multi-storey point-block tower with only 3 units per floor - quite private. Its signage is very discreet and not very familiar with taxis so keep a hotel card handy. However it is super convenient to get to and from from HKIA - only 30 minutes max! (not rush hour). Thirdly, the apartment layout is a marvel in space planning with the tiniest of rooms (if you can call them "rooms" 'cos they only fit the bed + a small built-in closet) but according to our HK relatives, this is the HK reality and norm. But the bedding is very clean, comfortable and luxurious. Windows are large and the spaces are always filled with light. In spite of the proximity to the highway, the well-insulated windows cut off all traffic noises. The only weird part of the apartment had to be the bathroom which SHOULD come with a door. Granted the toilet/WC was in a compartment of its own and the shower within a frosted glass screen, undressing in the dry area was nearly impossible because you were in direct view from the living room. We had to flip the WC door outwards to screen off the line of vision when using the bath. (Note to management: Installing an outer door at the side hallway is easy given the existing layout configuration). Finally, the service was quite wonderful and super courteous, English spoken widely, everyone was helpful right down to the main door security. Special requests are handled professionally and precisely. The ladies at the breakfast buffet would "mother" you and ply you with more food. Would we come back to OWK? Its a definite YES!

Reviews.Title: “Best value family accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: ariffaris
Reviews.Content: We were at Ovolo 256 Tung Chau Street for 3 nights and we were very happy with our stay. We were a family of 14, 8 Adults 6 Children and we took 2 of the 3 bedroom apartments. The rooms are very clean, modern and complete. We booked this hotel using Booking.com and we had no problems checking in. Check-in was fast, wifi was fast and free. Upon arrival we were given a note telling us that all the snacks and drinks in the rooms are complimentary! There was a microwave oven, toaster and refrigerator. What surprised me was also the TV had local channels, cable and also apple tv! this was a first! too bad we didn't have enough time to sit and watch tv. The hotel is in between 2 MTR stations which is both about 10mins walk. Its also only 5 stops away from Tsim Sha Tsui area. Overall, it was a good stay and i would strongly recommend this hotel to families looking for group accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for your Dollar”
Reviews.Author: mike g
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise. Great 3 bedroom apartment. No cooking facility, only a microwave and kitchen utensils. No plates or bowls. Very clean, and staff was pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was continental, but filling. There is no washing mashine in the room, and no laundry facility in the hotel. We were able to get laundry washed offsite, through the hotel, at a very reasonable price though. Compfortable beds, and nice hot shower. As a group, we left the bathroom door open to give a person in the shower more pivacy. About 5 minutes walk to the MTR station, no problems in the neighborhood. Free DVD's to use while you stay there...just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyFarFromHome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located halfway between the Nam Cheong station on the Tung Chung line and the Sham Shui Po station on the Tsuen Wan - a five or 10 min. walk either North or South. They have a small gym at ground level, a basic breakfast, and everything that is needed in the rooms to prepare small meals. There were two small bedrooms off the main room in my case. Internet was good but only with a hardwired connection. For some reason didn't have experience with the Wi-Fi to my laptop but that could have been me. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: baby_ling
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious as in the picture they provided. When we once checked in, the floors was very dirty when we walk barefooted in the room. Staff don't really talk or intro the location much to you as we are first time to hong kong. location was okay. Less than 100m there's a eatery.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation for group traveling”
Reviews.Author: sprarom
Reviews.Content: The room: We stayed in a 3-bedroom apartment for two nights. Compared to a usual HKG hotel room size the space we had here was very spacious for us. The apartment is equipped with almost all necessary stuff travelers could need - large flat screen TV with heaps of international channels, Apple TV, DVD player, fridge, toiletries, microwave, and etc. I noticed they also have an iPad for borrow. There was no kitchen utensils in the kitchenette but this wasn't a big concern for us as we normally eat out. Cleanliness may be the only issue I would like to raise. The floor of the apartment was quite greasy due to an unknown cause. I felt a bit disgust to walk barefoot in the room. Lucky they provided slippers so the problem fixed. But still I would appreciate if they take a better care in the cleanliness of the unit. Facilities: There is no restaurant on site, only a small dining area with a tiny bar on the lobby floor where continental breakfast is served. Free soft drinks are provided and you can get free drinks of alcohol during 6 to 8pm. No swimming pool on premise but they have a small gym on the ground floor. Location: A little drawback for this place is its location. This apartment isn't in the city centre, or isn't even close to any tourist attraction. The nearest MTR would be the Sham Shui Po station which is about 10 mins walk from the premise. Nearby areas: There is a busy morning market nearby where you can get brekkie and it turns into a local market selling second hand stuff at night. Although the surrounding atmosphere during the night is obviously not for tourists but we didn't feel unsafe to walk back to the unit. Services: Noting to complain. Their service is just what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Will definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Arpi1102
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ovolo for 5 days. The staff were very warm and helpful. The hotel is very close to both the MTR's and walking at all hours is very safe. The hotel staff can also call for a cab if you do not want to take the Mtr. The rooms are small but very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “256 Tung Chau Street”
Reviews.Author: FamilyJohnsonUK
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 6 - 2 adults, 4 kids - 14yrs, 9 yrs, 8 yrs and 5 yrs - and we booked a 3 bedroom apartment direct through the Ovolo website. The site said there was no availability but the amazingly helpful bookings coordinator from Ovolo emailed back very quickly and said he could fit us in but we might have to swap apartments during our week stay - we accepted and in fact we didn't have to. Superb. The area the apartment is in is fine - it's not the department store sterile / no atmosphere of some we have stayed in - but it is safe and friendly. All the store owners we spoke with were veyr helpful and friendly. The building is between two MTR stations - both 5 mins walk in opposite directions - one takes you on the central line through Mong Kok and straight down to Tsim Sha Tsui (which is the main place where you can go to the Star Ferry / tourist office / musuems etc) and the other is Nam Cheong which is a direct line to Hong Kong going South or Lantau Island for the Buddha or Disneyland. All the MTR journeys are super quick and so for us to get to Central (HK Island) station from the apartment was less than 30 mins. And with kids that's not bad! The apartment itself is good - briliant air conditionning so you sleep very soundly on comfy beds with feather duvets. The shower is superb. TV is flat large screen - when we were actually in the apartment it had all the cable channels you could want. And the added bonus that the website doesn't tell you is that breakfast is free - cereal / toast / buns / coffee / juice and that from 6pm to 8pm is 'happy hour' with coca cola / sprite / spirits / wine all for free! Reception staff were very helpful and friendly (they phoned for delivery pizza for us when we asked!). All in it was great. Sooo much cheaper than hotels and if you're intent is to travel around the whole area then this is perfectly placed to go to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “unhesitatingly recommend to friends and colleagues”
Reviews.Author: XaLex_C
Reviews.Content: Staying at this property is was no regret, I've enjoyed my entire stay was pleasant. It exceeded past expectations even knowing it was newly opened. The location was excellent as it was an easy 5 mins walk away from BOTH MTR stations Sham Shui Po and Nam Cheong. Within the vicinity, Golden Dragon Shopping Ctr which provides an array of shops . There’s a pharmacy, small department store, food court, restaurants, stalls, push carts and fast food! Also if you are abit geeky you can get cheap electrical goods from golden computer center beside Sham Shui Po MTR! Steet shops were abundant with cheap goods and food. We have stayed at the 3-bedroom apartment which is enough space for everyone. 2 Double beds and 1 Single bed rooms catered to my stay. Upon Arrival, were escorted to the room greeted by a welcome memo which is a personalized touch. The Service Apartment provided and large list of facilities and I was very impressed with the gym, complimentary wifi, iPad Dock, Apple TV, Cable TV, and free-flow drinks at the reception. They even provided an apple charger. Rooms had their own DID line. Services which were still to be implemented during my stay which I missed but have to mention were, complimentary DVD rental, complimentary Xbox360 Rental, complimentary Wii rental with game selection and Self-Launderette station. All bookings appear to include breakfast but please be aware that breakfast is very simple. With so much ‘complimentary services’ breakfast was a compromise but you can find many other places for breakfast. A tremendous place for dim sum was a restaurant at Dragon Centre please try if you could. The Hotel uses technology to its fullest extent; did I not mention the iPad Dock, Apple TV, Cable TV? Also note that there is iPad rental for use at the lobby. The room keys is ‘tap to open/access’ which intercom system at the entrance and great gym equipment. As self-launderette was not available at the early stages of opening, ALL laundry with no exception was complimentary WHAT A VALUE FOR BUCK! With laundry free, it was delivered as SAME DAY ‘express’ service which I received in the evening. STAFF was extremely nice and would greet guests consistently. An outstanding staff member was Jackie, she recommended plenty of places to visit during our 10-day stay and all recommendations were decent, from food to places of interests to family activities like the Ocean Park. Steve is also very pleasant and exceeded my expectations when I had a simple request late in the evening for extra pillows. These comments applied equally to all staff we encountered from those servicing the room to the front of house and following this thoroughly enjoyable experience I would go out of my way to stay here again and would unhesitatingly recommend to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “We extended our stay”
Reviews.Author: Andre47Caolundra
Reviews.Content: We were there for a family holiday and found Ovolo to be a great alternative to normal rooms or 1 bedroom suites. A reasonable price and reasonable size but the real winners were the staff, seldom have I had the pleasure of dealing with people so willing to help, suggest places to visit and just have a friendly word to say, Jackie and the team couldn't have done more for us. Sure theres the odd teathing problem with somewhere new such as not yet any washing machines but to overcome this they send your laundry away for you free of charge, or not having the room set up quite right for the number of guests staying there but these were quickly resolved and are very minor. Ovolo is close to two Mtr stations on different lines so transport is very easy and its close to local shopping and markets. If I was to visit Hong Kong again I would have no hesitation on staying at Ovolo West Kowloon again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay in West Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: ytyger
Reviews.Content: I had previous experience at the Shum Shui Po area about 2 years back, being the heartland to the Kowloon districts although not hot spot to attract major tourism, I thought rates of accommodation around that area are quite affordable…Quite convenient location, I think everything is within walking distance and you get to see the very local side of Hong Kong. The hotel itself is exactly like the pictures on the websites. Talking to the staff (very friendly!) and local, apparently this place has newly launched under brand new management. The decor is very modern and new, with top entertainment systems…DVD..X-Box..iPod dock…the complimentary WIFI is good.... interiors were very sleek and chic. We slept peacefully, no noise from other rooms. It appears that the new management are knocking this place into shape. My stay 5 days stay at Tung Chau Street was absolutely bonus to my trip in Hong Kong! I really recommend this hotel to young people who want to have fun.

HotelInfo.Name: Ovolo Hotel - 256 Tung Chau Street, West Kowloon
HotelInfo.Address: No.256 Tung Chau Street, West Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
